column4: I'm trying to mount a file and it sais it can't find him in the /etc/fstab or /etc/mtab, what does that mean?
now when trying to mount with the path, it sais I must specify a filesystem
why should I convert it then?
erm, it's a game CD, I don't know
, it's an image of a CD, I just want to mount it so I can install whatever inside the CD :P
tried that nix, and RAOF, isn't there a way to just mount a .BIN file? without converting?
it sais "wrong fs type, bad option, bad superblock on /dev/loop0 missing codepage or other error"
man do you have not only bin but and cue file there ?
